title: 'Shariat first, then Constitution': JMM minister sparks row, BJP hits back
content: The BJP strongly criticized Jharkhand minister Hafizul Hassan for his "a Muslim keeps the Quran in his heart and the Constitution in his hand" remarks, deeming them an insult to Indian democracy. Speaking on the ongoing Waqf protests Hassan had said that Muslims hold the Quran in their hearts and the Constitution in their hands. The BJP accused the INDIA bloc of harboring individuals who prioritize religious law. Hassan had alleged the Centre is targeting Muslims and warns of potential unrest.

title: Fresh violence hits Bengal: Vehicles torched, many hurt in anti-Waqf stir
content: Clashes broke out in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas between ISF supporters and police during protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act. The violence escalated when police prevented protestors from marching to a rally, resulting in torched vehicles, injuries, and arrests. This follows similar unrest in Murshidabad, prompting calls for central intervention and deployment of central forces.

title: How India could be Trump's trump card in 'encircling' China
content: The US is crafting a strategy to counter China's global influence, with India playing a central role. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent envisions a coalition with India, Japan, Vietnam, and South Korea to isolate Beijing economically. India's openness to US trade deals and rejection of Chinese investments signal a strategic alignment, though it remains intertwined with Chinese supply chains.

title: Katy Perry, Bezos' fiancée back on Earth after reaching space
content: Katy Perry, Gayle King, and Lauren Sánchez soared into space aboard a Blue Origin rocket from West Texas, marking the company's 11th human flight. The all-female crew, including Aisha Bowe, Amanda Nguyn, and Kerianne Flynn, saw Perry express her mission as boundary-breaking, inspiring young girls to dream big.

title: US: We will Revoke or Deny Visa if your FB or Instagram posts are ...
content: USCIS has officially declared that social media posts, particularly those deemed anti-Semitic or supportive of designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah, can now lead to US visa rejection or revocation. This policy, effective immediately, impacts student visas and Green Card applications. Secretary of State Marco Rubio confirmed the cancellation of visas for hundreds of international students.

title: 'Biden's war, not mine': Trump after Zelenskyy's Ukraine invite
content: After Ukraine president Volodymyr Zelenskyy appealed to President Trump to visit Ukraine following a fresh Russian attack on Sumy that Russia denied, Trump repeated that he has nothing to do with the Russia-Ukraine war. "President Zelenskyy and Crooked Joe Biden did an absolutely horrible job in allowing this travesty to begin. There were so many ways of preventing it from ever starting. But that is the past," he posted on Truth Social.

title: Rahul Tripathi's stunning catch lights up his 100th IPL game - Watch
content: In his 100th IPL match, Rahul Tripathi's spectacular catch stole the show during the CSK versus LSG game at Ekana Stadium. Tripathi's athletic dive at mid-off dismissed Aiden Markram off Khaleel Ahmed's delivery, giving CSK a brilliant start after they chose to bowl. CSK made two changes, including Shaik Rasheed and Jamie Overton, while LSG brought back Mitchell Marsh.

title: $22bn pivot: How Apple's India bet is paying off amid US-China trade war
content: Apple's iPhone production in India has surged by 60% to $22 billion, now accounting for one in five iPhones globally. This shift, driven by geopolitical tensions and supply chain vulnerabilities, positions India as a key export hub. Foxconn is expanding its manufacturing footprint in Uttar Pradesh, signaling a long-term commitment to India's growing industrial ecosystem.

title: Marco Rubio to diplomatic missions: Deny US Visa to applicants who ...
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has directed diplomats to rigorously examine social media content of visa applicants, particularly students. This directive aims to bar individuals suspected of criticizing the US or Israel. Consular officers must refer certain student visa applicants to the fraud prevention unit for mandatory social media checks.

title: How Mehul Choksi plans to resist extradition to India from Belgium
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in India for allegedly defrauding Punjab National Bank (PNB) of nearly Rs 14,000 crore, has been arrested in Belgium. His legal team is contesting extradition, citing the case's political nature and Choksi's poor health, including cancer treatment and PTSD from a prior alleged kidnapping.

title: Watch: KL Rahul's heartwarming fan moment steals the spotlight
content: Despite a batting failure in Delhi Capitals' loss to Mumbai Indians, KL Rahul's heartwarming post-match gesture towards fans in wheelchairs went viral. He posed for photos, signed autographs, and interacted with supporters, showcasing his kindness. This act of compassion became the highlight, overshadowing the team's defeat and highlighting the human aspect of sports.

title: Watch: PM Modi helps barefoot admirer fulfil 14-year vow
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Rampal Kashyap, an admirer who vowed to remain barefoot until Modi became Prime Minister and they met. At a Haryana rally, Modi fulfilled Kashyap's 14-year vow by personally putting shoes on him. While acknowledging the affection, Modi urged supporters to channel their devotion into social work and nation-building projects during his visit to Haryana.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: President Trump's push to revitalize US manufacturing through tariffs faces challenges, particularly for tech giants like Apple heavily reliant on Chinese production. Despite some supply chain diversification, Apple's iPhone manufacturing remains largely in China due to scale, speed, and specialized skills.

title: IPL: Why R Ashwin was dropped against Lucknow Super Giants
content: Chennai Super Kings made changes for their match against Lucknow Super Giants. Ravichandran Ashwin was dropped from the team. Jamie Overton and Shaik Rasheed replaced Ashwin and Devon Conway. MS Dhoni wanted to bowl first due to dew. Lucknow Super Giants included Mitchell Marsh. Rishabh Pant also wanted to bowl first. CSK aimed to improve their performance after recent losses.

title: Big blow for Punjab Kings! Star pacer likely to miss remainder of IPL 2025
content: Punjab Kings face a setback as Lockie Ferguson is likely out for the remainder of IPL 2025 due to a serious left thigh injury sustained against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Fast bowling coach James Hopes confirmed Ferguson's indefinite absence, creating a void in Punjab's pace attack. The team will now consider replacements like Xavier Bartlett, Azmatullah Omarzai, Vijaykumar Vyshak, and Yash Thakur.

title: NIA grilling Rana for 8-10 hours daily to uncover 'larger conspiracy'
content: Tahawwur Rana, the alleged mastermind of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is currently being interrogated by the NIA for up to ten hours daily. Extradited from the US, Rana is held in a high-security cell in Delhi. The NIA aims to uncover the broader conspiracy behind the attacks that killed 166. Rana is cooperating, and has requested a pen, some paper or a notepad, and a copy of the Quran.

title: Anti-Waqf protests: Plea in SC seeks SIT probe into Murshidabad violence
content: A plea has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking a court-monitored SIT investigation into the Murshidabad violence during anti-Waqf law protests. The petition also seeks protection for vulnerable lives and properties. Following the violence, the Calcutta High Court ordered CAPF deployment. Authorities are working to restore peace, with some families returning home.

title: India has requested fugitive Choksi's extradition, confirms Belgium
content: Fugitive Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 13,000 crore PNB bank loan fraud, has been arrested in Belgium following an extradition request from India. Indian authorities are actively pursuing his extradition, presenting arrest warrants to Belgian officials. Choksi's lawyer is contesting the extradition, citing concerns about human rights and prison conditions in India, claiming the case is politically motivated.

title: 'We are allowed to lose, smile': DC captain's dressing room message
content: Delhi Capitals faced a defeat against Mumbai Indians, ending their winning streak. Despite the loss, the team's spirit remained high. Skipper Axar Patel encouraged the team to stay positive. Coach Hemang Badani praised individual performances, especially Karun Nair's impressive return. The team is focused on maintaining momentum and looking ahead to future games.

title: 'Migrating within Bengal': TMC minister's odd claim amid anti-Waqf riots
content: Amidst protests against new Waqf laws and claims of communal violence in Murshidabad, West Bengal minister Firhad Hakim downplayed the situation, stating that people are relocating within the state, not fleeing. BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari alleges that over 400 Hindus were forced to leave their homes due to the violence, blaming Trinamool Congress' appeasement policies.

title: UP woman stripped off hijab, Hindu man beaten in Muzaffarnagar; 6 held
content: In Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, a shocking incident occurred on April 12, where a 20-year-old woman was allegedly assaulted and stripped of her hijab. The Hindu man accompanying her was also beaten by a group of men. The police have registered an FIR and arrested six individuals in connection with the assault, which took place in the Khalapar area.

title: Know everything about Salman Khan’s bodyguard Shera
content: Salman Khan, a Bollywood icon, has been protected by his dedicated bodyguard, Shera, for almost three decades. Their bond extends beyond professional duty, with Shera considering Khan his 'Maalik' and vowing to protect him at all costs. Shera's loyalty is unwavering, even leading Khan to honor him by featuring Shera's security company logo in his film 'Bodyguard'.

title: 'They did injustice': Pashupati Kumar Paras announces RLJP's exit from NDA
content: Pashupati Kumar Paras, chief of the RLJP, declared his party's departure from the NDA, citing perceived injustice and neglect. Paras highlighted the party's loyalty since 2014 but expressed disappointment over being ignored in recent NDA meetings in Bihar. The RLJP is now preparing for the 2025 state assembly elections and open to considering alliances with the INDIA bloc if given due respect.

title: 'Credit should go to Hardik, not Rohit': Commentators spark debate
content: Mumbai Indians secured a crucial win against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2025. Post-match discussions focused on Rohit Sharma's possible tactical role. Sanjay Bangar credited Sharma for a key decision. Sanjay Manjrekar argued that Hardik Pandya, as captain, deserved the credit. The debate sparked discussions among fans regarding team leadership. The incident highlights the dynamics within the Mumbai Indians camp.

title: 'Rajat Patidar's captaincy a mix of Virat Kohli & MS Dhoni'
content: Rajat Patidar silenced critics after being appointed RCB captain, transforming the team into a dominant force with four wins in six matches. Despite initial doubts and comparisons to Virat Kohli, Patidar's calm yet aggressive leadership, blending Dhoni-esque composure with Kohli's intent, has revitalized RCB.

title: PM lays foundation stone for new terminal at Hisar airport
content: Prime Minister Modi laid the foundation for a Rs 410-crore terminal at Hisar Airport, enhancing Haryana's connectivity. New flights will connect Hisar to Ayodhya, Jammu, Ahmedabad, Jaipur, and Chandigarh. Since 2014, the number of airports has doubled to 150, with the UDAN scheme connecting 90 airports and making air travel more accessible.

title: PNB scam: How Mehul Choksi was tracked down and arrested in Belgium
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 14,000 crore PNB scam, has been arrested in Belgium following renewed extradition efforts by Indian probe agencies. After evading authorities since 2018, Choksi was detained from a hospital where he was receiving medical treatment. Indian agencies are completing extradition procedures, while Choksi may seek relief on medical grounds.

title: Dreams on hold: Indian students face the heat of Australia’s visa overhaul
content: Australia’s sweeping student visa reforms, aimed at reducing net migration, have sparked concern among Indian students and education stakeholders. Stricter rules and a sharp drop in approvals — with Indian visas falling by 48% — have raised fears of discrimination and policy opacity. The move also risks straining Indo-Australian ties and weakening Australia’s global education appeal.

title: 'Unscientific, junk it': Karnataka caste census report divides Congress
content: A leaked Karnataka caste census report proposing increased OBC and Muslim reservations has ignited controversy within the Congress government. The report suggests raising OBC reservation to 51% and Muslims to 8%, sparking accusations of being "unscientific." Vokkaligas and Lingayats are recommended 7% and 8% quotas, respectively. With total reservations potentially reaching 73.

title: Watch: Fists fly in the stands as fight erupts at Arun Jaitley Stadium
content: Delhi Capitals' winning streak ended abruptly against Mumbai Indians amidst on-field tension and off-field violence. A fan brawl marred the match, raising concerns about stadium security, while a collision between Karun Nair and Jasprit Bumrah ignited a heated exchange. Adding to Delhi's woes, captain Axar Patel was fined for a slow over-rate, impacting their standing in the league.

title: Explained: Why are umpires randomly checking bats in the IPL?
content: In the last week, on-field umpires have checked bats of multiple players during the Indian Premier League (IPL). Shimron Hetmyer, Hardik Pandya and Phil Salt have all had their bats checked at different times in IPL matches. What is the reason behind the interruptions in play?

title: NFL world mourns Kyren Lacy as players like Wilson lead emotional tributes
content: The football world mourns the sudden passing of LSU's Kyren Lacy, prompting heartfelt tributes from NFL stars like Russell Wilson and Ja'Marr Chase. Teammates, including Jayden Daniels and Amik Robertson, shared personal memories and touching final messages, highlighting Lacy's profound impact on and off the field. The LSU community rallies to honor his legacy, remembering his spirit and work ethic.

title: PM Modi hails Sankaran Nair ahead of 'Kesari 2' release
content: Narendra Modi praised Kerala's Sankaran Nair for his fight against British rule. This was after the 1919 Jallianwala Bagh tragedy. Modi wants people in Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal to know Nair's story. A film on Nair's legal battle, "Keasari 2", is releasing soon. Nair resigned from the Viceroy's Executive Council in protest.

title: Lodha brothers resolve disputes over brand names
content: Abhishek and Abhinandan Lodha have settled their dispute. The dispute was regarding the use of 'Lodha' and 'Lodha Group' brand names. Macrotech Developers will own the 'Lodha' brand. Abhinandan will retain the 'House of Abhinandan Lodha' brand. Both groups will operate independently. The Bombay High Court had appointed a mediator. The mediator helped in resolving the matter.

title: 'Enemies of Babasaheb': Kharge counters PM's 'votebank ka virus' charge
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has strongly criticized the BJP, labeling them as historical and current adversaries of B.R. Ambedkar. This retort followed PM Modi's accusation that Congress spreads "votebank ka virus" by opposing the Waqf Amendment Act.

title: From Antigua to Belgium: Will Choksi finally be extradited to India?
content: Mehul Choksi, wanted in connection with the Rs 13,000 crore PNB loan fraud, has been arrested in Belgium following a request from India for his extradition. This development follows the removal of an Interpol Red Notice and renewed efforts by Indian authorities to bring him back. Choksi had previously fled to Antigua and Dominica after the scam's exposure.

title: Machete-wielding teens on bikes: Rising trend in Bengaluru alarms cops
content: Bengaluru is witnessing a surge in incidents involving youths brandishing machetes and performing dangerous stunts, prompting concern from law enforcement and mental health experts. Recent arrests highlight a troubling trend of aggression and weapon possession among adolescents. Psychiatrists attribute this behavior to unresolved emotional issues and urge parents to be vigilant and seek professional help when needed.

title: 'Paid twice': Auto driver who dropped Saif Ali Khan attacker identifies him
content: The chargesheet in Saif Ali Khan's attack case reveals Shariful Fakir, an illegal Bangladeshi national, was dropped near Khan's residence hours before the incident. CCTV footage captured Fakir surveying the area and entering the building.

title: 7 years after pulling out, why is Trump re-engaging Iran on nuclear deal?
content: Iran is not allowed to have nuclear weapons because it is a member of the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT), which it signed along with most other countries. This agreement allows countries to use nuclear technology only for peaceful purposes, like energy, medicine, and agriculture. It strictly prohibits the development of nuclear weapons.

title: Mehul Choksi undergoing cancer treatment, to seek bail - Top developments
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, wanted in the PNB scam, has been apprehended in Belgium. India faces an uphill battle for his extradition, as Choksi is likely to cite health issues to resist returning. Whistleblower Hariprasad SV doubts Choksi's return, given his resources and legal support. Nirav Modi, also implicated, remains jailed in London, fighting extradition.

title: Furore over Karnataka caste survey data, many netas call it ‘unscientific’
content: A leaked Karnataka caste census report has ignited controversy, revealing recommendations to increase backward caste reservations to 51%. The report, which has divided the ruling Congress, suggests specific reservation percentages for Muslims, Vokkaligas, and Veerashaiva-Lingayats. Opposition parties criticize the report, while community leaders question its accuracy, prompting a special cabinet meeting to address the contentious findings.

title: 'Votebank ka virus': PM Modi attacks Congress for opposing Waqf Act
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a strong critique of the Congress party on Monday, accusing them of exploiting the Constitution for political gain and neglecting Dr. BR Ambedkar's vision. He highlighted the Emergency and alleged politicization of reservations. Modi contrasted this with the BJP's development-focused approach.

title: 'Jaat' box office collection: Sunny Deol starrer to 'hold steady', cross Rs 50cr
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' is performing strongly at the box office, showing significant growth over its opening weekend, particularly on Sunday. The film has earned Rs 41.47 crore in India and is approaching the Rs 50 crore mark, potentially boosted by the Ambedkar Jayanti holiday. In the south centres, 'Jaat' is facing competition from Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly'.

title: Who are the most fun teams to watch this season? Let's rank all 30
content: Star power, mammoth home runs and ... cotton candy fries? Here are baseball's most exciting squads for 2025.

title: Pelicans fire executive VP Griffin after 6 seasons
content: The Pelicans have fired executive vice president David Griffin after six years as the team's head of basketball operations.  The Pelicans had a 209-263 record and twice made the playoffs during his tenure.

title: Officials: Ex-LSU WR Lacy died in apparent suicide
content: Former LSU receiver Kyren Lacy, who was found dead Saturday night in Houston, died in an apparent suicide in his car while being pursued by authorities, according to a Harris County sheriff's report released Sunday.

title: Rory coaster ride nets Masters win, career Slam
content: Rory McIlroy gave up a big lead on the second nine and bogeyed the 72nd hole to create a tie, but he recovered to beat Justin Rose in a playoff to win the Masters.

title: Sources: Bueckers signing 3-year Unrivaled deal
content: Projected No. 1 overall WNBA draft pick Paige Bueckers is signing a three-year deal with the 3-on-3 league Unrivaled, sources told ESPN, and her first-year salary will pass what she would make in four years of her WNBA rookie contract, sources said.

title: Former NCAA woman of year dies in plane crash
content: Karenna Groff, a former MIT soccer player named the 2022 NCAA woman of the year, died Saturday, along with members of her family, in a plane crash in upstate New York.

title: Thunder, Celtics betting favorites to win NBA title
content: The Thunder and reigning champion Celtics are the consensus favorites to win this season's title, showing +180 and +190 odds, respectively, at ESPN BET.

title: Illini star freshman Jakucionis to enter NBA draft
content: Illinois freshman Kasparas Jakucionis, a projected top-10 pick, told ESPN that he will enter the 2025 NBA draft.

title: Lakers will lean on Luka in prepping for Wolves
content: Seeing as he faced them in the playoffs last year, the Los Angeles Lakers plan to rely on Luka Doncic's experiences in playing the Timberwolves, this year's Round 1 opponent, after the superstar defeated Minnesota as a member of the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Projecting all three rounds of the WNBA draft
content: The Dallas Wings are on the clock. From Paige Bueckers to pick No. 38, our mock draft projects every pick.

title: Seattle's pick at No. 2? Five questions heading into the draft
content: Who might challenge Paige Bueckers for Rookie of the Year? Which team is positioned to win the WNBA draft?

title: 'It's the best day of my golfing life': Rory McIlroy finally gets his green jacket
content: There were plenty of nerves involved, but in the end, McIlroy finally won the Masters, got to put on the winner's jacket and completed the career Grand slam.

title: From 'Ted Lasso' appearances to honest talks about being fired: Inside Pete Carroll's USC class
content: This spring, in addition to being named head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders, Carroll has been moonlighting as a college professor.

title: Why Sedona Prince is the toughest WNBA draft prospect to evaluate
content: She's a skilled 6-7 center, but some GMs have expressed doubt about drafting Sedona Prince after accusations of intimate partner violence.

title: NBA playoffs 2025: First-round news, scores and highlights
content: Here's everything you need to know about the 2025 NBA playoffs, including scores, news and highlights.

title: 30 years after Ki-Jana Carter went No. 1, Ashton Jeanty can help RBs regain draft prominence
content: Running backs are cool again in the NFL, and they're the strongest position group in this class. But will a running back get picked first ever again?

title: How high would Ohio State's Jeremiah Smith go in this draft? We asked NFL insiders
content: Smith won't be eligible for the draft until 2027, but the league is already excited about his talent.

title: Real Madrid, Mbappe's malaise, Man United adrift, Bayern's Der Klassiker lessons, more
content: Mbappe's red card punctuated another bad Madrid outing -- not good ahead of the second leg with Arsenal. Elsewhere, Bayern learned a lot from Der Klassiker and Man United look completely lost, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Mbappé 'sorry' for rash red card - Madrid coach
content: Kylian Mbappe was shown a straight red card for a dangerous challenge during the first half of Real Madrid's crucial La Liga clash with Alavés.

title: Messi 'changing how world sees MLS' with Miami
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano credited Lionel Messi for impacting the growth of Major League Soccer since signing with the club in 2023, but quickly added that more progress can be made.

title: Liverpool near title after VVD winner, Salah record
content: Liverpool resumed their march to a second Premier League title on Sunday after beating West Ham United 2-1, with Mohamed Salah breaking the record for most goal involvements in a season and Virgil Van Dijk scoring a late winner.

title: Amorim won't commit to Onana for Europa League
content: Ruben Amorim said he will wait to make a decision on his goalkeeper for the crucial Europa League clash with Lyon after omitting Andre Onana from the defeat to Newcastle on Sunday.

title: Points then pints: Wolves boss hits pub with fans
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers coach Vitor Pereira is happy to swap the wine of his native Portugal for the beer of England's Black Country as he celebrates his side's 4-2 home win over Tottenham Hotspur on Sunday.

title: Salah makes Van Dijk plea as CB hints at new deal
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has said he would "love" to play with Virgil van Dijk next season after the Dutchman dropped a massive hint over his future.

title: Barcelona vs Real Madrid scheduled for May 11
content: The potentially title-deciding Clásico between Barcelona and Real Madrid at the Olympic Stadium has been scheduled for May 11.

title: Heartbreak for Brady as Birmingham lose in final
content: Birmingham City were dealt a shock 2-0 defeat by Peterborough United in the Vertu Trophy final at Wembley Stadium on Sunday, with NFL legend and minority owner of the club Tom Brady watching on.

title: Who will new featherweight title-holder Volkanovski fight in his first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility? Let's talk about matchups after UFC 314.

title: MLS Power Rankings: New No. 1 Vancouver proves it's for real
content: While Miami sputtered vs. Chicago, Vancouver jumped to No. 1 in our MLS Power Rankings by demolishing Austin.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid want Haaland if Vinícius Júnior leaves
content: Real Madrid have been linked with a huge move for Erling Haaland if Vinícius Júnior leaves. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Explained: The Punjab National Bank Scam That Shook Banking System
content: Seven years after he fled India just before the discovery of an astronomical Rs 14,000 crore scam, fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi was arrested in Belgium over the weekend.

title: Defence, Space, Technology: Decoding India's Entry Into Elite Club
content: Over the past decade, India has undergone a transformation that has reshaped its global standing from a developing nation with potential to a powerhouse pushing boundaries across defence, space, and technology.

title: Video: PM Modi Gifts Shoes To Man Who Vowed Not To Wear Footwear Till...
content: The Prime Minister on Monday met Rampal Kashyap from Kaithal, who had vowed 14 years back not to wear footwear until Narendra Modi takes over as PM.

title: Singer Katy Perry, Jeff Bezos's Fiancee Fly To Space On All-Woman Flight
content: Pop star Katy Perry became the biggest name in an all-woman group to safely blast off into space Monday, roaring into the cosmos on one of billionaire Jeff Bezos's rockets.

title: Who Will Be NDA's Bihar Chief Minister Face? BJP Minister's Clarification
content: Hours after Tejashwi Yadav's fiery remarks on Ambedkar Jayanti, accusing the BJP and NDA of being anti-reservation and anti-Ambedkar, Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary fired back, strongly defending the NDA's commitment to social justice.

title: Andhra Man Strangles 8-Month Pregnant Wife After Argument
content: A man killed his eight-month pregnant wife after an argument this morning in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. The police have arrested the accused.

title: 1 Kg Cocaine Worth Rs 6 Crore Seized In Chennai, 8 Arrested
content: Two kilograms of cocaine worth Rs 6 crore were seized in Chennai, leading to the arrest of eight individuals linked to a drug trafficking network.

title: Donald Trump May Impose Martial Law-Type Order On April 20. What We Know
content: One of the first executive orders that Donald Trump signed as US President on January 20 was to declare a "national emergency" along US' southern border. That order had a rider to it - that President Trump might "invoke the Insurrection Act of 1807".

title: Probe Agency's Key Plea On Mehul Choksi Stuck In Mumbai Court For 7 Years
content: Even on the run, Mehul Choksi, a key accused in the Punjab National Bank loan fraud case, has been arrested in Belgium, the ED's plea to declare him a fugitive economic offender has been pending before a court in Mumbai for nearly 7 years.

title: UP Woman Assaulted by Mob, Headscarf Removed, Hindu Man with Her Beaten
content: A girl in a burqa and a Hindu man accompanying her were harassed and assaulted in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh.

title: Pope Puts Spain's Sagrada Familia's Architect Antoni Gaudi On Path To Sainthood
content: The Catholic Church has put Antoni Gaudi, the designer of Barcelona's Sagrada Familia basilica, nicknamed "God's architect", on the path to sainthood, the Vatican said Monday.

title: Tahawwur Rana Identified New Delhi For Attacks Similar To 26/11: Court
content: A court here has noted that Mumbai terror attack mastermind Tahawwur Hussain Rana had identified New Delhi for attacks akin to the 26/11 strikes as part of a conspiracy that travelled beyond the geographical borders of India.

title: Video: Delhi College Principal Paints Classroom Wall With Cow Dung
content: Standing atop a wooden desk, she bends from time to time to scoop up poop, cowdung to be exact, and then smears it around the walls, shows a video.

title: 26/11 Mastermind Tahawwur Rana's 3 Requests To Probe Agency NIA
content: Mumbai terror attacks key mastermind Tahawwur Hussain Rana is being interrogated for eight to ten hours daily by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) sleuths to unravel a larger conspiracy behind the dreaded strikes, PTI reported.

title: After Sweden, Denmark Aims To Eradicate Cervical Cancer By 2040
content: Denmark aims to eradicate cervical cancer by 2040 thanks to a national HPV vaccination campaign and screening programme, the Danish Cancer Society said on Monday.

title: Apple Takes Top Spot In First-Quarter Global Smartphone Sales
content: Apple took the top spot for global smartphone sales in the first quarter on the back of the iPhone 16e's launch and strong demand in countries such as Japan and India, data from Counterpoint Research showed on Monday.

title: Hamas Promises Release of Hostages If End To Gaza War Guaranteed
content: A senior Hamas official said on Monday that the Palestinian group is prepared to release all Israeli hostages in exchange for a "serious prisoner swap" and guarantees that Israel will end the war in Gaza.

title: Japan's Birth Rate Declines, Sees Record Drop In Population In 2024
content: Japan's population fell to 120.3 million as of October 2024, official data showed on Monday, marking a record fall of 898,000 people from the previous year.

title: PM's "Bulldozer" Dig At Congress Amid Hyderabad Forest Tree Felling Row
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi targeted the Congress today over the felling of trees in Hyderabad, that has already turned into a government versus civil society row.

title: Supreme Court's Tamil Nadu Governor Verdict Has Message For President Too
content: Only courts have the prerogative to provide recommendations regarding the constitutionality of a Bill and the Executive is supposed to exercise restraint in such matters, the Supreme Court has said

title: Waqf violent protest: On a tough legal wicket, TMC faces a delicate balancing act
content: 10 most beautiful red coloured flowers that grow in summer How to make high-protein Soyabean and Paneer Pulao in a pressure cooker ​In pics: Elegant looks of actress Fouzee​ Sanjana Sanghi ethnic look wins hearts 10 must-visit UNESCO Heritage sites in Europe for history lovers Top 8 elephant safari destinations in India 10 animals with the most beautiful eyes Ambedkar Jayanti 2025: 8 must-read books by Babasaheb Ambedkar How to use Raisin water to increase hair growth

title: When Choksi was honeytrapped & kidnapped from Caribbean island
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Postseason bracket first look: X factors, best-case scenarios, big questions
content: the Eastern Conference bracket was finalized on friday . there are now officially 20 teams fighting for a chance to win the Larry O'Brien trophy . no team has repeated since the Warriors in 2017 and 2018, making this one of the longest droughts without a repeat champion .

title: Fantasy baseball buzz: Justin Steele and all you need to know for Monday
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the episode of forearm soreness that Steele experienced in late 2024 was an indicator of things to come, as his 2025 season has come to an abrupt conclusion .

title: Volkanovski is back, Pimblett shines -- again
content: Alexander Volkanovski defeated Diego Lopes by unanimous decision to win the featherweight championship . yair Rodriguez revived his career with an impressive performance to ruin Patricio Pitbull's debut . "Old Man Volk" is champion once again but the division is a lot different than the one he reigned over .

title: How the standings can shift with Monday's six games
content: the six games taking place on tuesday are scheduled for the end of the regular season . 14 of 16 clubs have punched their tickets, though a variety of seeds remain in contention . a win by the Columbus Blue Jackets on Sunday kept them in the playoff race for at least one more day .

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Banda's Pride No. 1, winless Utah sink
content: barbra Banda beats barbra 1-0 at home to make it 1-0 . barbra are still the team to beat after defeating reign 1-0 on saturday . kate moss' side are outshot 13 to 7 and 5 to 4 on target .

title: Truckers’ strike against price rise begins; movement of goods across Karnataka likely to be hit
content: Barring milk delivery vehicles, all other goods carriers, including those transporting fuel, LPG, construction material, and essentials, will remain off the roads

title: Murdered girl suspected to be sexually abused, accused said to have been intoxicated
content: The victim’s family members carried out her funeral rites after the body was handed over to them following post-mortem in Hubballi

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu slams critics of ‘P4’ initiative, reiterates commitment to eliminating economic inequalities
content: Highlighting the transformative impact of the programme in empowering the poor, the Chief Minister lauds the entrepreneurs and industrialists who have stepped forward to support the cause

title: ASI seeks to shed new light on Dwarka through underwater expeditions, scientific analysis of recovered antiquities
content: The new study by the ASI has undertaken onshore and offshore expedition at Dwarka and Beyt Dwarka in Gujarat to search, document and study submerged archaeological remains in the place as well as ascertain the antiquity of the recovered objects through scientific analysis of sediments, archaeological and marine deposits

title: Clash between BJP, Congress party workers over plaque at Ambedkar statue’s pedestal in Rajasthan
content: Congress MLA among those involved in the scuffle over the plaque that was unveiled to the public in Bonli two years ago during Congress rule

title: Law Minister says Mamata Banerjee’s remark of not implementing Waqf law in Bengal is ‘not right’
content: Arjun Ram Meghwal noted Mamata Banerjee made a similar remark during the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, and said, “But CAA was implemented in West Bengal”

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu reinstates Ambedkar Overseas Education Scheme in Andhra Pradesh
content: Reiterating the government’s commitment to the uplift and educational empowerment of Dalits, the Chief Minister says around 7,000 students benefited from the scheme in 2014-19

title: West Bengal teachers rendered jobless take their protest to Delhi
content: Apart from a sit-in protest at Delhi’s Jantar Mantar on April 16, also planned is a march from Sealdah to Raj Bhavan, protests across different districts, a ‘relay hunger strike’, and an indefinite fast from May 8

title: Mining operations halted in A.P. due to coalition government, allege Tirupati MP
content: Though the mine owners have all the permits, the leaders of alliance parties are threatening them, claims Maddila Gurumoorthy

title: Caste census report: Veerashaiva Mahasabha plans its own survey; DKS to meet Vokkaliga MLAs today
content: Joint meeting of Mahasabha representatives with office bearers of Rajya Vokkaligara Sangha may take place before the Cabinet meet

title: Ambedkar is a global icon in the struggle for equality, says Khandre
content: He dedicated his life to eradicating social inequality, according to the Forest and Environment Minister

title: Modi ‘humbled’ by man who vowed not to use footwear till he met PM
content: Fourteen years ago, Rampal Kashyap had vowed not to use footwear till Narendra Modi became the Prime Minister and met him in person.

title: Centre frames draft rules for gas meters
content: The rules make it mandatory for all gas meters used for domestic, commercial, and industrial purposes to undergo testing, verification and stamping prior to their use in trade and commerce

title: Rich tributes paid to Dr. Ambedkar in Kurnool, Nandyal and Anantapur districts
content: Ministers, MPs and Collectors participate actively in the Ambedkar Jayanthi celebrations held across the three districts, lionise the Father of the Indian Constitution as the champion of social justice and equal rights

title: SEIL Energy observes National Fire Service Day
content: The Nellore-based independent power producer is conducting various activities during National Fire Service Fortnight from April 14 to 28

title: CPI accuses BJP of undermining the spirit of Constitution
content: Party’s national secretary Mr. Narayana expresses regret over the fascist mentality of the Union government and calls upon public to oppose such ideologies that could break the country from within

title: MP calls for fast-tracking of Chittoor railway station modernisation, Tirupati-Katpadi doubling works
content: The Tirupati–Katpadi railway line doubling project would boost Chittoor district’s growth and integrated development, says Daggumalla

title: Hailstorm, heavy gales uproot trees in Chittoor
content: Uprooted trees fall on highway at Nelavai village in SR Puram mandal, causing traffic blockade for several hours

title: Two interstate burglars held for house break-in in Kerala's Kochi
content: The prime accused has a similar case registered against him at Aroor police station in Alappuzha district

title: Ambedkar proposed Sanskrit as national language, recalls NSU Vice-Chancellor
content: MP Daggumalla Prasada Rao, IMA national vice-president Daggumati Srihari Rao and ISRO scientist T. Srinivas Reddy pay floral tributes to Dr. Ambedkar

title: S&LP: BEE appreciates APSECM’s market surveillance measures
content: Standards and Labelling Programme helps the consumers in making informed decisions about energy-efficient appliances and equipment by providing star ratings

title: The paints cure as renowned tribal artist ‘Kitna’ passes away in the Nilgiris
content: R. Krishnan is credited by most members from the Alu Kurumba community of almost single-handedly popularising the community’s artistry through his canvas and cloth paintings for the best part of three decades

title: Safety lapses found in Nagpur factory blast, case booked
content: A report by the Directorate of Industrial Safety and Health found that the factory had failed to provide Personal Protective Equipment to its workers, thereby exposing them to high risk

title: YSR Congress Party challenges Wakf Act in Supreme Court
content: It alleges serious constitutional violations and failure to address the concerns of the  Muslim community

title: A.P. Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan’s wife offers prayers at Tirumala temple
content: Anna Lezhneva offers her hair, signs declaration form, takes part in Suprabhatam Seva, and donates ₹17 lakh towards one-day lunch expense at Nitya Annadanam Complex

title: Centre sanctions 160 new fire tenders for State, says A.P. Fire Services DG
content: In East Godavari district, two new fire stations are being constructed in Rajamahendravaram Rural and Devarapalli

title: Police seize 2 kg cocaine in Chennai, arrest 8 persons
content: The accused alleged that they found the contraband on the sea shore while collecting plastic waste. Investigation revealed that they were planning to sell the contraband in the city

title: Minister emphasizes on adherence to the Constitution, hails Babasaheb’s contribution
content: He gave the world’s biggest constitution to India when the country was in need of having its own constitution after Independence, says Darshanapur

title: Thousands gather at Deekshabhoomi, Chaityabhoomi to mark Ambedkar’s birth anniversary
content: The Maharashtra government and Mumbai civic authorities had made special arrangements including medical camps, water facilities, and traffic management to handle the influx of visitors

title: Energy labels under watch: BEE cracks down on fake star ratings
content: BEE intensifies appliance label checks to protect consumers; praises Telangana Renewable Energy Development Corporation Ltd (TGREDCO) for energy rule enforcement

title: Man climbs stage carrying machete, arrested in Raichur district
content: The incident occurred when expelled BJP MLA Yatnal was addressing a gathering during Ram Navami celebrations in Lingsugur of Raichur

title: Government will support women in becoming industrialists: Bharath
content: Industries and Commerce Minister appreciates voluntary organisations which came forward to train women in preparing millet-based products at ‘pauSHEtik’, a women entrepreneurship development programme in millet-based baking, held in Kurnool

title: SBI chairman visits Yadagirigutta, hands over two EVs to temple
content: The vehicles are specifically intended to assist senior citizens, women and persons with disabilities, ensuring their convenience and comfort while navigating the temple premises

title: Violations galore during Karunakar Reddy’s term as Trust Board Chairman, says TTD Executive Officer Syamala Rao
content: Vigilance probe has unearthed severe violations at the dairy farm, including serving of maggot-infested fodder and discarded maize silage to the cattle, use of expired drugs and unhygienic conditions in the cattle sheds, he says

title: Constitution empowers marginalised people, says Joshi
content: The Union Minister has said that even an ordinary person from a common family can reach high position due to B.R. Ambedkar’s Constitution

title: Staff shortage hits Budalur Government Hospital
content: With a capacity of around 40 beds, the hospital has only three doctors, one of whom is on deputation from the Thirukkattupalli Government Hospital and four vacancies of doctors are yet to be filled

title: Dharwad gets metal replica of the Preamble weighing 1,500 kg
content: This comes as the nation celebrates the 134th birth anniversary of the architect of the Constitution B.R. Ambedkar

title: Daily power consumption in A.P. may reach 260 MUs this summer, says Chief Secretary
content: Efforts are being made to ensure uninterrupted power supply as the rise in temperatures is causing an increase in the grid load, says Vijayanand

title: Ambedkar transcended caste and religion, says Lad
content: The Labour Minister and Dharwad in-charge has said that attempts are being made to confine Ambedkar to a particular caste or community

title: India-born doctor Joy Saini, family killed in New York plane crash
content: A renowned urogynecologist Dr. Joy Saini, along with her husband Dr. Michael Groff and their children were heading to Catskills Mountains for a birthday celebration

title: Tahawwur Rana asked for pen, paper, Quran; NIA questioning him for eight to ten hours daily
content: NIA officials are ensuring Rana’s medical check-up and he is being allowed to meet his lawyer, sources said

title: Sanction faculty for Central Tribal University of Andhra Pradesh, Araku MP urges Union government
content: She writes a letter to Prime Minister and Union Education Minister seeking sanction of  77 teaching and 51 non-teaching posts for the university

title: Shift Lord Ram’s idol from pedestal where communist leader’s statue stood: CPI(M) to Tripura CM
content: The statue of former Deputy Chief Minister Baidyanath Majumder in the State’s Kailashahar town was demolished after the BJP came to power in 2018

title: Minor girl gangraped in Uttar Pradesh’s Kasganj, 8 nabbed
content: An FIR in this regard was registered under BNS sections 70 (gangrape), 126 (2) (wrongful restraint), 308 (5) (extortion) among others and the POCSO Act on April 12, the police said.

title: Saudi Arabia ‘cancels’ 52,000 Hajj slots; J&K CM, Mehbooba urge MEA to intervene
content: Ruling and Opposition parties in J&K unite to address Saudi Arabia’s cancellation of Hajj slots for Indian pilgrims

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Tight security for Samayapuram temple car festival on April 15
content: A total of 13 teams have been formed to prevent crimes such as chain-snatchings during the Chithirai car festival which is expected to attract over 3 lakh people

title: Merger with SAIL will solve financial problems of Visakhapatnam Steel Plant, says SAIL Independent Director
content: ‘SAIL has vast experience in the steel business and it has abundant mineral sources and marketing facilities across the country’

title: Minister inaugurates desilting project in Mayiladuthurai
content: Minister for Welfare of Backward Classes Siva V. Meyyanathan launches work on  ₹24.80-lakh desilting project at Sembiyavelankudi village in Sirkazhi taluk

title: Five IEDs planted by Maoists recovered in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: The IEDs were detected on a dirt track near Mankeli village by a joint team of the Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF) and local police when it was out on an area domination and demining operation

title: SSC sends list of 'tainted', 'untainted' candidates to Bengal education department
content: Education Minister Bratya Basu had earlier announced that the list would be made public on the WBSSC website by April 21, following legal consultation.

title: Highways department to build new bridge across Koraiyar on Madurai Road in Tiruchi
content: A new four-lane bridge will be constructed in the place of the existing structure which will be demolished. Land acquisition had been completed for widening the approach roads

title: Got offer to conduct ‘encounter’ of sarpanch murder case accused Karad: suspended cop
content: A senior police official from Beed, however, dismissed suspended cop Kasle’s claims as baseless and said he should submit a proof of his statements

title: Next year's Bengal Assembly polls must be held under President's rule: Suvendu Adhikari
content: ‘Wherever Hindus are in the minority, they are stopped from voting. Police act like cadres of the ruling party,’ Mr. Adhikari told reporters in Kolkata

title: Investors' wealth erodes by ₹11.30 lakh crore since reciprocal tariffs announcement; Sensex drops 2%
content: Market participants fear that tensions between the world's two largest economies could cause widespread global damage.

title: Place Gig Workers draft Bill in public domain for stakeholders views: Telangana CM
content: The Government wants to enact the Act on May 1 (International Labour Day); there are 4 lakh gig workers in Telangana

title: Bihar CM, Union Sports Minister unveil logo, mascot of Khelo India Youth Games 2025
content: Bihar CM says it is a matter of great happiness that the Games is being organised in Bihar; Prime Minister Narendra Modi to inaugurate the sporting event in Patna on May 4, 2025
